Of course he won't be too quick to act upon it but he will fight if he's fo=
rced into it.  He fights only if he sees that the opponent is causing harm =
to an innocent being.  Other than that he will not jump at it too quick.

P=
erpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 18, 2011, at 3:10 PM, =
Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> I have no problem, with =
most of that. :)
>  
> One thing to keep in mind, when Rodimus was sassing =
the preds, he was saying it quietly, in fact he whispered it and at that ti=
me Tuscon was hovering in the air which means is that only Tuscon could hav=
e heard it. So from Rodimus' view point the way Tuscon responded was a HUGE=
 overreaction, since he could have just ignored it, like most primes do. Th=
ink about how Ratchet responded to so many of Optimus' ideas or those of ot=
hers. Anyways, it's all good to me :)
>  
> As for that battle of honor, I =
can imagine that happening, but there are other factors at work. This is no=
t an enemy that you can walk in the front door, challenge to a duel, win an=
d then walk back out. This is one that will take time to vanquish. Tuscon w=
ill be fortunate to get out in one peace. :)
>  
> Magmatron is a very old =
soldier, and his been through countless battles and he is most likely the m=
ost formidable opponant that Tuscon or perhaps anyone else here on Old Eart=
h has met thus far, except for maybe some of the older Unicronians. 
>  
> =
Do not be too quick to act is my advise to Tuscon.
>  
> - Preston 
> 
> On=
 Sun, Sep 18, 2011 at 10:36 AM, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:=

>  
> Cool, so even when Rodimus sees lightning and hears thunder, he too =
will think of Tucson or may very well see him and those elements in a dream=
.  After all, he did get an idea of his stormy like temper before they got =
separated .  It would be interesting to have a battle between Magmatron and=
 Tucson, as a challenge to preserve the land from further harm.  One on one=
, in an honorable battle, in warrior mode of course.  And the one who remai=
ns on his feet, wins the freedom of the land and it's inhabitants.  He who =
loses, must retreat honorably and give up the opposition he so desperately =
fights for.  It would be an ultimate test of Honor and courage for Tucson, =
who must realize that sometimes doing the right thing is to anticipate defe=
at and learn from that in order to avoid it the next time one faces a formi=
dable enemy.  It's a lesson no mentor can teach him, it's a lesson he needs=
 to learn on his own.  
> 
> I think it's a good plot seeing that for a bot=
, he has a lot of backbone and unlike Rodimus, perhaps just a little too mu=
ch of it.  It goes with having his father's temperament and stubbornness.  =
That too is turning out to be a challenge for him, because Ratchet may have=
 been the chief CMO, but never a Prime.  Tucson, who is very much like Ratc=
het, is a Prime who is having to work with temperament issues as well as th=
e issues impacting everyone else.
> 
> When Rodimus started sassing the Pre=
ds while on Tucson's back, Tucson was trying desperately to form an allianc=
e and was not in the mood for snide commentary.  His reaction was similar t=
o how Ratchet might have commented on it.  Good thing Rodimus didn't get th=
e classic " Give me one good reason why I shouldn't reformat your hard driv=
e and turn you into a garbage scow!"
> But when Tucson lost his temper Rodi=
mus may have picked up on his voice pattern which sounds EXACTLY like Ratch=
et when he lost his temper.  I don't recall Rodimus's relationship with Rat=
chet but he could probably get an idea that Tucson is from the same mold as=
 the old CMO.
> 
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Of course he won't be too quick to act=
 upon it but he will fight if he's forced into it.  He fights only if =
he sees that the opponent is causing harm to an innocent being.  Other=
 than that he will not jump at it too quick.<br><br>Perpetually on the move=
 and constantly busy. </div><div><br>On Sep 18, 2011, at 3:10 PM, Supe=
r Cyclonus <<a href=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@gma=
il.com</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><di=
v>




<span style=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-te=
xt">
      
      
      <p></p><div>I have no problem, with most of that. =
:)</div>
<div> </div>
<div>One thing to keep in mind, when Rodimus was=
 sassing the preds, he was saying it quietly, in fact he whispered it =
and at that time Tuscon was hovering in the air which means is that on=
ly Tuscon could have heard it. So from Rodimus' view point the way Tus=
con responded was a HUGE overreaction, since he could have just ignore=
d it, like most primes do. Think about how Ratchet responded to so many of =
Optimus' ideas or those of others. Anyways, it's all good to me :)</div>

<=
div> </div>
<div>As for that battle of honor, I can imagine that happe=
ning, but there are other factors at work. This is not an enemy that you ca=
n walk in the front door, challenge to a duel, win and then walk back out. =
This is one that will take time to vanquish. Tuscon will be fortunate to ge=
t out in one peace. :)</div>

<div> </div>
<div>Magmatron is a very ol=
d soldier, and his been through countless battles and he is most likely the=
 most formidable opponant that Tuscon or perhaps anyone else here on O=
ld Earth has met thus far, except for maybe some of the older Unicronians.&=
nbsp;</div>

<div> </div>
<div>Do not be too quick to act is my advise=
 to Tuscon. </div>
<div> </div>
<div>- Preston <br><br></div>
<di=
v class=3D"gmail_quote">On Sun, Sep 18, 2011 at 10:36 AM, Sandy Panico <spa=
n dir=3D"ltr"><<a href=3D"mailto:magicquartz@..."><a href=3D"mailt=
o:magicquartz@...">magicquartz@...</a></a>></span> wrote:<br=
>
<blockquote style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: #ccc 1px solid;" class=3D"gmail_quote">=
<u></u>
<div style=3D"BACKGROUND-COLOR: #fff;"><span> </span> 
<div>
<=
div>
<div>
<p>
</p><div>Cool, so even when Rodimus sees lightning and hears=
 thunder, he too will think of Tucson or may very well see him and those el=
ements in a dream.  After all, he did get an idea of his stormy like t=
emper before they got separated .  It would be interesting to have a b=
attle between Magmatron and Tucson, as a challenge to preserve the land fro=
m further harm.  One on one, in an honorable battle, in warrior mode o=
f course.  And the one who remains on his feet, wins the freedom of th=
e land and it's inhabitants.  He who loses, must retreat honorably and=
 give up the opposition he so desperately fights for.  It would be an =
ultimate test of Honor and courage for Tucson, who must realize that someti=
mes doing the right thing is to anticipate defeat and learn from that in or=
der to avoid it the next time one faces a formidable enemy.  It's a le=
sson no mentor can teach him, it's a lesson he needs to learn on his own. &=
nbsp;</div>

<div><br></div>
<div>I think it's a good plot seeing that for =
a bot, he has a lot of backbone and unlike Rodimus, perhaps just a little t=
oo much of it.  It goes with having his father's temperament and stubb=
ornness.  That too is turning out to be a challenge for him, because R=
atchet may have been the chief CMO, but never a Prime.  Tucson, who is=
 very much like Ratchet, is a Prime who is having to work with temperament =
issues as well as the issues impacting everyone else.</div>

<div><br></div=
>
<div>When Rodimus started sassing the Preds while on Tucson's back, Tucso=
n was trying desperately to form an alliance and was not in the mood for sn=
ide commentary.  His reaction was similar to how Ratchet might have co=
mmented on it.  Good thing Rodimus didn't get the classic " Give me on=
e good reason why I shouldn't reformat your hard drive and turn you into a =
garbage scow!"</div>

<div>But when Tucson lost his temper Rodimus may have=
 picked up on his voice pattern which sounds EXACTLY like Ratchet when he l=
ost his temper.  I don't recall Rodimus's relationship with Ratchet bu=
t he could probably get an idea that Tucson is from the same mold as the ol=
d CMO.</div>

<div class=3D"im">
<div><br>Perpetually on the move and const=
antly busy. </div></div>
<div>
